Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Betsalel, the name of two Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Uri, the name of three Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Chur, the name of four Israelites and one Midianite

a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

31.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor)

32.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver)

33.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor)
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)

34.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread)
Dan, one of the sons of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory; likewise a place in Palestine colonized by them

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
wisdom (in a good sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to variegate color, i.e. embroider; by implication, to fabricate
the cerulean mussel, i.e. the color (violet) obtained therefrom or stuff dyed therewith
purple (the color or the dyed stuff)
the crimson-grub, but used only (in this connection) of the colorfrom it, and cloths dyed therewith
crimson, properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it
bleached stuff, i.e. white linen or (by analogy) marble
